Description: Six beads made in different shapes and colours: A: segmented cylindrical bead with wide grooves and round edges, made of bluish-greyish paste (frit?), four segments long. B: three fragments of segmented cylindrical beads with thin grooves and angular edges, in white faience, all broken off at one end, largest one measured. C: ring bead made of blue paste (frit?). D: disc bead made of turquoise faience.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
